page.title: 18INDUSTRY - Continued
page.content: Where Alfords trading estate is now there used to be the old railway station. The{railway}was the busiest during the last war. There are six factories on the estate being{Paul {Nevils, John Whites, V.W.Graphics. There is also an{Upholsterer, Tony {Duros}and a firm for{motor cycle {parts.}There are still signs of the railway on the estate and they are the station house and some buildings. The biggest factory on the estate is John Whites. John Whites was on the railway before it closed and the factory used to process potatoes. The estate has been there twelve years but it wasn't built till about two or three years after the railway had closed. There used to be a{goods yard}on the estate and it was the only building destroyed by a German bomb during the Second World War.
